definition: fatalism/fatalistic
constellation
lodge for the night/old/former
night/classifier for nights
surname Su
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Rock climbers and sports car drivers must be fatalist.
sentences.chinese: 攀巖運動汽車司機必須是宿命論者。

sentences.english: Fatalism is an excuse of the weak-willed.
sentences.chinese: 宿命論是那些缺乏意志力的弱者的藉口。

sentences.english: Maybe it's from the Bible, I think, because Lincoln is a fatalist .
sentences.chinese: 林肯是個宿命論者，我猜是出自《聖經》。
宿命論是納齊恩斯基的唯一寄託。

sentences.english: I guess I am a fatalist.
Are you superstitious? I guess I am a fatalist.
sentences.chinese: 你迷信嗎？我猜我是個宿命論者。

sentences.english: Who ever heard of a fatalistic farmer?
sentences.chinese: 誰聽說過一個鄉下人是宿命論者？

sentences.english: I am a fatalist and I believe in football you win and you lose.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個宿命論者，我相信足球輸贏的言論。

sentences.english: But all had a sense of fatalism.
sentences.chinese: 但所有人都變成了得過且過的宿命論者。
第二，不要做個宿命論者。

sentences.english: Fatalism - Fatalism is a way people rationalize despair.
sentences.chinese: 宿命論是人們合理化絕望的一個藉口。

sentences.english: IT IS MY LIFE. I just want to live while i am alive.
sentences.chinese: 這是我的人生，雙子座其實從來都是宿命論者。

definition: rationalism
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
nihilism
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
optimism
divination/divinatory art
general principle
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
likes and dislikes
